data.event: Warren was first settled in 1664 and was officially incorporated on January 16, 1741 as the town of Western.
Warren was first settled in 1664 and was officially incorporated on January 16, 1741 as the town of Western.
Originally a part of Quaboag Plantation, the town now known as Warren was part of Brookfield for 68 years until it was renamed Western.
Originally a part of Quaboag Plantation, the town now known as Warren was part of Brookfield for 68 years until it was renamed Western.
On March 13, 1834, the town was renamed Warren in honor of General Joseph Warren, who died at the Battle of Bunker Hill during the American Revolutionary War.

event.title: January 13, 1834, a town meeting was held

data.event: On January 13, 1834, a town meeting was held to discuss a name change.
Shortly thereafter, the town petitioned the legislature to change the name, which was soon done, and the first town meeting under the name "Warren" was held on April 28, 1834.
